FuncDef:
The instance command creates a MAP-T or a MAP-E instance and displays the MAP-T OR MAP-E instance view.
The undo instance command deletes a MAP-T instance or a MAP-E instance.
By default, no MAP-T or MAP-E instance is configured in the system.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a MAP instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies a global index of a MAP instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4095.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To create a MAP instance, run the map-instance command:
If this command is run for the first time, a MAP instance is created, and the MAP instance view is displayed.If a MAP instance already exists, the MAP instance view is displayed.

Precautions
MAP-T and MAP-E instances can be created. The total number of both instances is 64 on a device.
